pullRequest.title: CLDR-8383 fix some SQL issues with mail
pullRequest.bodyText:
CLDR-8383

cannot use first() on a forward only updateable resultset, changed to next()
cleaned up SurveyLog so that error messages aren't repeated.
(Exception.toString() includes Exception.getMessage(), so do not need a separate getMessage())

fyi @btangmu
SQL err was java.sql.SQLException: Result set type is TYPE_FORWARD_ONLY

commit.message:
CLDR-8383 fix some SQL issues with mail

- cannot use first() on a forward only updateable resultset, changed to next()
- cleaned up SurveyLog so that error messages aren't repeated.
 (Exception.toString() includes Exception.getMessage(), so do not need a separate getMessage())

beforeCommit.message:
CLDR-???? fix some SQL issues with mail

- cannot use first() on a forward only updateable resultset, changed to next()
- cleaned up SurveyLog so that error messages aren't repeated.
 (Exception.toString() includes Exception.getMessage(), so do not need a separate getMessage())

afterCommit.message:
CLDR-8383 fix some SQL issues with mail

- cannot use first() on a forward only updateable resultset, changed to next()
- cleaned up SurveyLog so that error messages aren't repeated.
 (Exception.toString() includes Exception.getMessage(), so do not need a separate getMessage())

nodes.bodyText: this had put the message in twice,  t.toString() already has the message

this is the core change.  A forward-only cursor can't go "back" to next, and it turns out it is formally an error, even if 'rs.next()' is the first call.
There may be more instances of this, but this is the only  one i found.

this confused me (though I wrote it :) …so i added the comment.
Under heavy load, should more than one be processed at a time?
